text: The following is a list of notable events and releases of the year 1898 in Norwegian music. ==Events== ; June * 26 – The first Norwegian music festival was held in Bergen on initiative by Edvard Grieg (June 26 – July 3). ; Unknown date * Olaus Alvestad publishes the songbook Norsk Songbok for Ungdomsskular og Ungdomslag. ==Deaths== ==Births== ; January * 5 – Rolf Gammleng, violinist and organizational leader (died 1984). ; June * 2 – Ola Isene, opera singer (baritone) and actor (died 1973). ; August * 7 – Eyvind Hesselberg, organist, composer, and conductor (died 1986). ; December * 4 – Reimar Riefling, classical pianist, music teacher, and music critic (died 1981). ==See also== * 1898 in Norway * Music of Norway ==References== Category:Norwegian music Norwegian Music Category:1890s in Norwegian music
title: 1898 in Norwegian music
